equations.EQ:2: \,{\text{SiH}}_{4} \,\text{Si: 4 valence electrons/atom}\,\times \,\text{1 atom}=4 {+\,\text{H: 1 valence electron/atom}\,\times \,\text{4 atoms}=4}¯ \,=\text{8 valence electrons}
equations.EQ:4: \,{\text{CHO}}_{2}^{\text{−}}\,\text{C: 4 valence electrons/atom}\,\times \,\text{1 atom}=4\,\text{H: 1 valence electron/atom}\,\times \,\text{1 atom}=1\,\text{O: 6 valence electrons/atom}\,\times \,\text{2 atoms}=12{+\,\text{1 additional electron}=1}¯\,=\text{18 valence electrons}
equations.EQ:5: \,{\text{NO}}^{+}\text{N: 5 valence electrons/atom}\,\times \,\text{1 atom}=5\,\text{O: 6 valence electron/atom}\,\times \,\text{1 atom}=6\,{+\,\text{−1 electron (positive charge)}\,=−1}¯\,=\text{10 valence electrons}
equations.EQ:6: \,{\text{OF}}_{\text{2}}\,\text{O: 6 valence electrons/atom}\,\times \,\text{1 atom}=6\,{+\,\text{F: 7 valence electrons/atom}\,\times \,\text{2 atoms}=14}¯\,=\text{20 valence electrons}
